member.name: M:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Translate(System.Type)
member.summary: Converts the objects in the collection to the specified type. Calling this method is the same as calling with the second parameter set to , which means that exceptions will not be thrown for items that fail conversion.
member.param: The type to which items in the collection are being converted.
member.returns: A collection that represents the converted contents of the original collection.

member.name: M:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Translate(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the objects in the collection to the specified type and uses the specified fault tolerance to handle or ignore errors associated with a type not having a conversion mapping.
member.param: The type to which items in the collection are being converted.

A Boolean value that determines how conversion errors are handled.
If is , conversion errors due to a mapping not being found for the translation result in a failed conversion and exceptions being thrown.
If is , types that failed to convert due to a mapping not being found for the translation are copied without being converted into the collection being returned.
member.returns: A collection that represents the converted contents of the original collection.

member.name: P:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.
member.returns: The number of objects in the collection.

member.name: P:System.Security.Principal.IdentityReferenceCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the node at the specified index of the collection.
member.param: The zero-based index in the collection.
member.returns: The at the specified index in the collection. If is greater than or equal to the number of nodes in the collection, the return value is .

member.name: T:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels
member.summary: Defines the privileges of the user account associated with the access token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.AdjustDefault
member.summary: The user can change the default owner, primary group, or discretionary access control list (DACL) of the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.AdjustGroups
member.summary: The user can change the attributes of the groups in the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.AdjustPrivileges
member.summary: The user can enable or disable privileges in the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.AdjustSessionId
member.summary: The user can adjust the session identifier of the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.AllAccess
member.summary: The user has all possible access to the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.AssignPrimary
member.summary: The user can attach a primary token to a process.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.Duplicate
member.summary: The user can duplicate the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.Impersonate
member.summary: The user can impersonate a client.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.MaximumAllowed
member.summary: The maximum value that can be assigned for the enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.Query
member.summary: The user can query the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.QuerySource
member.summary: The user can query the source of the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.Read
member.summary: The user has standard read rights and the privilege for the token.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.TokenAccessLevels.Write
member.summary: The user has standard write rights and the , and privileges for the token.

member.name: T:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType
member.summary: Defines a set of commonly used security identifiers (SIDs).

member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the certificate administrators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountComputersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account computer group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountControllersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account controller group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountDomainAdminsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account domain administrator group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountDomainGuestsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account domain guests group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountDomainUsersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account domain users group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountEnterpriseAdminsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the enterprise administrators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountGuestSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account guest group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountKrbtgtSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account Kerberos target group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountPolicyAdminsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the policy administrators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountRasAndIasServersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the RAS and IAS server account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AccountSchemaAdminsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the schema administrators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AnonymousSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for the anonymous account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.AuthenticatedUserSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for an authenticated user.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BatchSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for a batch process. This SID is added to the process of a token when it logs on as a batch job.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinAccountOperatorsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the account operators account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinAdministratorsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the administrator account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinAuthorizationAccessSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the Windows Authorization Access group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinBackupOperatorsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the backup operators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinDomainSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the domain account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinGuestsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the guest account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinIncomingForestTrustBuildersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that allows a user to create incoming forest trusts. It is added to the token of users who are a member of the Incoming Forest Trust Builders built-in group in the root domain of the forest.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinNetworkConfigurationOperatorsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the network operators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinPerformanceLoggingUsersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the group of users that have remote access to monitor the computer.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinPerformanceMonitoringUsersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the group of users that have remote access to schedule logging of performance counters on this computer.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinPowerUsersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the power users group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinPreWindows2000CompatibleAccessSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches pre-Windows 2000 compatible accounts.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinPrintOperatorsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the print operators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinRemoteDesktopUsersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches remote desktop users.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinReplicatorSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the replicator account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinSystemOperatorsSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the system operators group.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.BuiltinUsersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches built-in user accounts.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.CreatorGroupServerSid
member.summary: Indicates a creator group server SID.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.CreatorGroupSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the creator group of an object.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.CreatorOwnerServerSid
member.summary: Indicates a creator owner server SID.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.CreatorOwnerSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the owner or creator of an object.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.DialupSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for a dial-up account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.DigestAuthenticationSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID present when the Microsoft Digest authentication package authenticated the client.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.EnterpriseControllersSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for an enterprise controller.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.InteractiveSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for an interactive account. This SID is added to the process of a token when it logs on interactively.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.LocalServiceSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches a local service.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.LocalSid
member.summary: Indicates a local SID.

member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the local system.

member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches logon IDs.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.MaxDefined
member.summary: Indicates the maximum defined SID in the enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.NetworkServiceSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches a network service.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.NetworkSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for a network account. This SID is added to the process of a token when it logs on across a network.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.NTAuthoritySid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for the Windows NT authority.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.NtlmAuthenticationSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID present when the Microsoft NTLM authentication package authenticated the client.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.NullSid
member.summary: Indicates a null SID.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.OtherOrganizationSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID present when the user authenticated across a forest with the selective authentication option enabled. If this SID is present, then cannot be present.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.ProxySid
member.summary: Indicates a proxy SID.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.RemoteLogonIdSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches remote logons.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.RestrictedCodeSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for restricted code.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.SChannelAuthenticationSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID present when the Secure Channel (SSL/TLS) authentication package authenticated the client.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.SelfSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for self.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.ServiceSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID for a service. This SID is added to the process of a token when it logs on as a service.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.TerminalServerSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches a terminal server account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.ThisOrganizationSid
member.summary: Indicates a SID present when the user authenticated from within the forest or across a trust that does not have the selective authentication option enabled. If this SID is present, then cannot be present.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WellKnownSidType.WinAccountReadonlyControllersSid

member.summary: Indicates a SID that matches the application package authority.

member.name: T:System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType
member.summary: Specifies the type of Windows account used.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType.Anonymous
member.summary: An anonymous account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType.Guest
member.summary: A Windows guest account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType.Normal
member.summary: A standard user account.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsAccountType.System
member.summary: A Windows system account.

member.name: T:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole
member.summary: Specifies common roles to be used with .

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.AccountOperator
member.summary: Account operators manage the user accounts on a computer or domain.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.Administrator
member.summary: Administrators have complete and unrestricted access to the computer or domain.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.BackupOperator
member.summary: Backup operators can override security restrictions for the sole purpose of backing up or restoring files.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.Guest
member.summary: Guests are more restricted than users.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.PowerUser
member.summary: Power users possess most administrative permissions with some restrictions. Thus, power users can run legacy applications, in addition to certified applications.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.PrintOperator
member.summary: Print operators can take control of a printer.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.Replicator
member.summary: Replicators support file replication in a domain.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.SystemOperator
member.summary: System operators manage a particular computer.

member.name: F:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole.User
member.summary: Users are prevented from making accidental or intentional system-wide changes. Thus, users can run certified applications, but not most legacy applications.

member.name: M:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous
member.summary: Returns a object that you can use as a sentinel value in your code to represent an anonymous user. The property value does not represent the built-in anonymous identity used by the Windows operating system.
member.returns: An object that represents an anonymous user.

member.summary: Returns a object that represents the current Windows user.
member.exception: The caller does not have the correct permissions.
member.returns: An object that represents the current user.

member.name: M:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetCurrent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a object that represents the Windows identity for either the thread or the process, depending on the value of the parameter.
member.param: to return the only if the thread is currently impersonating; to return the of the thread if it is impersonating or the of the process if the thread is not currently impersonating.
member.returns: An object that represents a Windows user.

member.returns: An object that represents the current user.
